info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Warren, northern Saratoga and west central Washington Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Corinth, or 12 miles northwest of Saratoga Springs, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saratoga Springs, Glens Falls, Warrensburg, Whitehall, Lake George Village, Corinth, Day Center, Bolton Landing, West Glens Falls, Lake Luzerne Campground, Glens Falls North, Kings, Mount Pleasant, Queensbury, Wilton, Greenfield, Mount Hope, South Glens Falls, Lake Luzerne and Bolton. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 17S and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
